continues as {{jct|state=SK|Hwy|10}} |cities=[[Dauphin, Manitoba|Dauphin]] |towns=[[Cartwright, Manitoba|Cartwright]], [[Glenboro, Manitoba|Glenboro]], [[Carberry, Manitoba|Carberry]], [[Neepawa, Manitoba|Neepawa]], [[McCreary, Manitoba|McCreary]], [[Ste. Rose du Lac, Manitoba|Ste. Rose du Lac]], [[Gilbert Plains, Manitoba|Gilbert Plains]], [[Grandview, Manitoba|Grandview]], [[Roblin, Manitoba|Roblin]] |established= |previous_type=Hwy |previous_route=4 |next_type=Hwy |next_route=6 }} '''Provincial Trunk Highway 5''' (PTH 5) is a provincial highway in [[Manitoba]], [[Canada]]. The highway starts at the U.S. border and ends at the [[Saskatchewan]] boundary 13.6 kilometres west of [[Roblin, Manitoba|Roblin]]. Along the way it passes through the communities of [[Cartwright, Manitoba|Cartwright]], [[Glenboro, Manitoba|Glenboro]], [[Carberry, Manitoba|Carberry]], [[Neepawa, Manitoba|Neepawa]], [[McCreary]], [[Sainte Rose du Lac, Manitoba|Ste. Rose Du Lac]], [[Grandview]], [[Gilbert Plains]] and the City of [[Dauphin, Manitoba]] (although a bypass via [[Manitoba Highway 5A|Highway 5A]] is available). Between the western junction with [[Manitoba Highway 10|PTH 10]] and [[Sainte Rose du Lac, Manitoba|Ste. Rose Du Lac]], this segment is called the '''[[Northern Woods and Water Route]].''' PTH 5, along with [[Manitoba Highway 20|PTH 20]] and [[Manitoba Highway 50|PTH 50]], has the distinction of being both a north-south and east-west highway. From the [[Canada â United States border]] to [[Manitoba Highway 68|PTH 68]] east of Ste. Rose du Lac, PTH 5 runs north-south. From Ste. Rose du Lac to the Saskatchewan border, the highway runs east-west. ==Route History== Before the highway was designated to its current length in the late 1970s, the southern terminus of PTH 5 was the [[Manitoba Highway 16|Yellowhead Highway]] in [[Neepawa, Manitoba|Neepawa]]. The segment of the highway between Neepawa and [[Manitoba Highway 3|PTH 3]] at [[Cartwright, Manitoba|Cartwright]], via [[Glenboro, Manitoba|Glenboro]] and [[Carberry, Manitoba|Carberry]], was previously designated as PR 258, while the segment between the U.S. border and Cartwright was formerly PTH 28. The section between [[Manitoba Highway 20|PTH 20]] and [[Manitoba Highway 10|PTH 10]] south of [[Dauphin, Manitoba|Dauphin]] was completed in the early 1960s. Prior to this, PTH 5 turned north at [[Ochre River, Manitoba|Ochre River]] and entered Dauphin from the east along what is now PTH 20 and [[Manitoba Highway 20A|PTH 20A]]. PTH 5 met PTH 10 south in Dauphin's city centre and then continued out of the city following the current PTH 5A/10A route. ==Travel Route== This is the travel route for Manitoba Provincial Trunk Highway 5 (PTH 5). it is divided into two sections; from south to north and from east to west. ====North-South section==== {| class="wikitable sortable" !km !Municipality !Location !Interescting highway !Notes |- |0 |rowspan=2|[[Roblin, Manitoba (rural municipality)|Roblin R.M.]] |colspan=2|'''[[Canada]] - [[United States|US]] border''' |PTH 5 begins |- |10 |[[Cartwright, Manitoba|Cartwright]] |{{jct|state=MB|PTH|3|city1=Boissevain|city2=Killarney|city3=Pilot Mound|city4=Morden}} | |- |29 |rowspan=5|[[Argyle, Manitoba|Argyle R.M.]] |[[Neelin, Manitoba|Neelin]] | | |- |32 | |bgcolor=DFF9F9|{{jct|state=MB|PR|253|dir1=east|city1=Pilot Mound}} |bgcolor=DFF9F9|begin PR 253 west concurrence |- |34 | |bgcolor=DFF9F9|{{jct|state=MB|PR|253|dir1=west|city1=Killarney}} |bgcolor=DFF9F9|end PR 253 west concurrence |- |47 | |{{jct|state=MB|PTH|23|city1=Elgin|city2=Ninette|city3=Baldur|city4=Somerset}} | |- |60 | |Mile 34N |formerly PR 245 east |- |70 |[[South Cypress, Manitoba|South Cypress R.M.]] |[[Glenboro, Manitoba|Glenboro]] |{{jct|state=MB|PTH|2|city1=Souris|city2=Wawanesa|city3=Holland|city4=Elm Creek}} | |- |108 |rowspan=4|[[North Cypress, Manitoba|North Cypress R.M.]] |[[Carberry, Manitoba|Carberry]] |{{jct|state=MB|PR|351|city1=Douglas|city2=Sidney}} | |- |111 | |{{jct|state=MB|PTH|1|name1=[[Trans-Canada Highway|TCH]]|city1=Virden|city2=Brandon|city3=Portage La Prairie|city4=Winnipeg}} | |- |125 |[[Wellwood, Manitoba|Wellwood]] |Mile 70N |formerly PR 353 east
